trans-unit.source: Represents a generic list of types that are defined by a contract and are used to pass collections of that contract type between a host and an add-in.
The <xref:System.AddIn.Pipeline.CollectionAdapters> class uses an <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601> interface to pass collections, in both directions, between the host and the add-in.
It is recommended that you use the <xref:System.AddIn.Pipeline.CollectionAdapters> class instead of using this class directly in your code.
For an example, see [Walkthrough: Passing Collections Between Hosts and Add-Ins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b532c604-548e-4fab-b11c-377257dd0ee5).
This class can be used to pass objects by reference between application domains because the objects are not serialized.
The contract type of the objects in the list.
Adds an object to an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
The `item` parameter must be of a type that is defined by the contract.
The object to add.
Removes all objects from an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
Determines whether a specific item is in an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
The object to look for in the collection.
`true` if item is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of items in an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
An <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IEnumeratorContract`1"></xref> enumerator to iterate through the collection.
Determines whether an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection is read-only.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the item at the specified index of an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
The <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.GetItem%2A> method does not remove the item at the specified index.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601> collection, use the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.RemoveAt%2A> method.
The zero-based index of the item to get.
The item at the specified index.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the return value of .
Returns the index of a specific item in an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.Collections.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
If there are several objects of the same type in the collection, this method identifies the index of the item that is the first occurrence of the specified type in the collection.
The <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.GetItem%2A> method does not remove the item at the specified index.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601> collection, use the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.RemoveAt%2A> method.
An item in the collection.
The index of the specified item.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the return value of the method.
Inserts an item at the specified index in an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
After you call the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.Insert%2A> method, the items that follow the insertion point move to accommodate the new item.
The indexes of the items that are moved are also updated.
To replace an item at a specified index, use the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.SetItem%2A> method.
To determine whether an <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601> collection is read-only, call the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.GetIsReadOnly%2A> method.
The zero-based index at which to insert item.
The <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IContract"></xref> object to insert in the <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the return value of .
The <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection is read-only.
Removes an item from an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection of a specified type.
You must repeat this method for each object of a particular type in the collection.
The item to remove from the collection.
`true` if an item is removed; otherwise, `false`.
Removes the item at the specified index in an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
After you call <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.RemoveAt%2A>, the items that follow the removed item move to occupy the vacated spot.
The indexes of the items that are moved are also updated.
To determine whether an <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601> collection is read-only, call the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.GetIsReadOnly%2A> method.
The index of the item to remove.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the return value of the method.
The <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection is read-only.
Sets the item at the specified index in an <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection.
The <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.SetItem%2A> method sets the item at the specified index.
To add an item to the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601> collection, use the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.Insert%2A> method.
To determine whether an <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601> collection is read-only, call the <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract%601.GetIsReadOnly%2A> method.
The zero-based index at which to set the item.
The item to set at the specified index.
index is less than zero.
-or-
index is equal to or greater than the return value of the method.
The <xref href="System.AddIn.Contract.IListContract`1"></xref> collection is read-only.
